medical_history.chief_complaint: Familial glucocorticoid deficiency (FGD) with symptoms of hyperpigmentation and hypoglycemia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 presented with symptoms in early childhood, including hyperpigmentation and febrile seizures at 6.5 months. Patient 2 displayed hyperpigmentation at 2 months and later experienced nausea, vomiting, dehydration, hyponatremia, hypoglycemia, and a grand mal seizure at 19 months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 1 had recurrent pneumonia and delayed motor and language development. Patient 2 had a history of mild jaundice and several upper respiratory infections.
medical_history.family_history: Patient 2 has a male sibling with hyperpigmentation and elevated ACTH levels at birth.
